cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles NNW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the southeastern and central Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast, aiming at southeast Louisiana / Mississippi River delta
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana near the mouth of the Mississippi River (west of Metro New Orleans)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cameron, Louisiana to the Mississippi/Alabama border including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for Louisiana at this advisory (warnings limited to Cayman Islands and parts of Cuba)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Sabine Pass TX eastward to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (up to 69% cumulative) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds with a 34% chance of 50-kt winds Sunday night into Monday; brief hurricane-force gusts possible as the core passes south of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water levels along Lake Maurepas and the lower Mississippi River could rise 3–5 ft; some surge influence may propagate upriver toward the port, threatening low-lying wharves and access roads.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches, locally 20 inches, expected across southeast Louisiana with considerable flash, urban, and river flooding potential around Baton Rouge.
weather_observation.other_hazards: River flooding, debris flow, power outages, possible channel restrictions and closures; dangerous currents and high waves on the river could halt cargo operations.
